answers.text:
Nikola, if you or your colleague have any questions about what NRC can do to help, please don't hesitate to get in touch. We work with hundreds of cities to conduct customized surveys in addition to The National Citizen Survey (which includes a full page of custom questions and may suit your needs better). My email address is jessica.sharp@n-r-c.com

answers.author: Cheryl Hilvert
answers.text:
Hi Nikola!  I applaud you for looking at the civic engagement element in considering your program analysis.   I wanted to let you know about a couple of resources you may wish to consider for your project, including the National Research Center and the various civic engagement service providers that are a part of ICMA's Center for Management Strategies.  
The National Research Center is a company that is a part of the Center for Management Strategies' efforts to provide leading practice training and technical assistance to local governments.  NRC provides support to community leaders who want to use data more efficiently and effectively. NRC specializes in the creation of low-cost, scientifically accurate surveys complete with reports that make sense to an array of community stakeholders.  NRC's signature products are the National Citizens Survey and National Employee Survey, but they also design specialized surveys to meet community needs.  The beauty of utilizing NRC is the wealth of data they have available on local governments through its signature survey products as well as the extensive experience in working with and on local government issues.  You can find more information on NRC at the following link:       http://www.icma.org/en/results/management_strategies/leading_practices/data_driven_communities
In addition to NRC, ICMA's Center for Management Strategies features a number of civic engagement practice leaders who can assist you directly or can work in concert with NRC on a project.   Information on our providers in civic engagement can be found at the following link:
http://icma.org/en/results/management_strategies/leading_practices/civic_engagement 
After you have looked over this information, please feel free to contact me at chilvert@icma.org if I can assist you in reaching any of these providers.
Good luck with your project!

author: Nikola Pavelic
text: Would anyone have any experience with a research based consultant who is good with numbers and community engagement? We are preparing a report for a study we'd like to do in regards to 211 services in our community and we'd like it to be a mix of qualitative and quantitative date which includes, in meaningful and relevant ways, our stakeholders which includes service providers, funders and service clients. Any advice on whom other communities have used for studies like this would be tremendously helpful. I'm trying to create a list of potential consultants/research firms we can reach out to in order to understand cost, processes, timing, etc.
title: Resource for a Community Study
